channel.title: A list of commands interface
channel.description: was wondering,How can I make a command called ::commands and it brings up a list of commands in an interface. Like on my server when i type ::mainmenu It says your pk stats and all that when you last logged in. All help appreciated. Cmon someone help :p

item.dc:creator: @BurnInSilence BurnInSilence

item.title: A list of commands interface
item.dc:creator: @BurnInSilence BurnInSilence
item.description:
@BurnInSilence wrote:

thats because your not using a furyscape base…“i know what i doing”…
add this to the bottom of our public void commandmenu()

flushOutStream(); }

then re add our command

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("commandmenu")){ commandmenu(); }

Read full topic

item.title: A list of commands interface
item.dc:creator: @rs_w00dcut rs w00dcut
item.description:
@rs_w00dcut wrote:

[quote=“BurnInSilence, post:4, topic:155220”]declared anywhere ;]

public void commandmenu () { sendQuest("@dre@commandmenu", 8144); clearQuestInterface(); sendQuest("You currently have "+pk points+"", 8147); sendQuest("the commands are as follow", 8148); sendQuest("blah blah", 8149); sendQuest("enter commands here", 8150); sendQuest("blah blah and so son", 8151); sendQuest("so on*", 8152); sendQuest("lol", 8153); }
note, that pk points thing wont work, i cant remember how to make it valid[/quote]All right,It should work if i add in the bottom of client.java right?

Read full topic

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("commandmenu")){ commandmenu(); }

item.title: A list of commands interface
item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

Owi, Opsi, I know how…

Okay, first, search this in your client.java…

mainmenu

it should come up with "something: like this: (try a couple of times until you get it)

}else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("mainmenu")) { mainmenu();

Then what you could do, is right below it, add:

}else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("commands")) { commands();

Then, go back to the top of your client.java, then search for, mainmenu()

Then this should come up (something like it)

public void mainmenu() { sendFrame126("@dre@Rules Menu", 8144); clearQuestInterface(); sendFrame126("", 8145); sendFrame126("@dbl@Welcome to @cya@FuryScape", 8146); sendFrame126("@dbl@", 8147); sendFrame126("@dbl@Welcome to FURYSCAPE!!@dbl@", 8148); sendFrame126("@dbl@Owner and Co-Owner:", 8149); sendFrame126("@dre@X F U R Y X", 8150); sendFrame126("@dre@I 0wNt4gE I", 8151);

Anyways, my point is that this is the interface…, So what you would do, is copy that whole thing, then paste it under it, and make it look like this…:

public void commands() { sendFrame126("@dre@Commands List!", 8144); clearQuestInterface(); sendFrame126("", 8145); sendFrame126("@dbl@--Command List--", 8146); sendFrame126("@dbl@", 8147); sendFrame126("@dbl@*::command here*@dbl@", 8148); sendFrame126("@dbl@*::command here*", 8149); sendFrame126("@dre@*::command here*", 8150); sendFrame126("@dre@*::command here*", 8151);

You get my point, you just gotta kinda check it out and mess around with it, compile a few times, redo the text… and stuff like that… Well, hoped this helped…

Btw, your title of the post is kinda missleading, thats why I posted a huge list of interface ids the first time…

Read full topic

item.title: A list of commands interface
item.dc:creator: @rs_w00dcut rs w00dcut
item.description:
@rs_w00dcut wrote:

was wondering,How can I make a command called ::commands
and it brings up a list of commands in an interface.
Like on my server when i type ::mainmenu
It says your pk stats and all that when you last logged in.
All help appreciated.
Cmon someone help

Read full topic
